meanings.definition: Resembling a saw in appearance or action.
meanings.sent1: The jagged edges of the toy sword looked sawlike.
meanings.sent2: The sawlike motion of the robot's arm was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The sawlike fins of the fish helped it glide effortlessly through the water.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a sawlike quality, cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The sawlike teeth of the zipper made it easy to open.

meanings.definition: Having teeth or projections like those of a saw.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had a sawlike pattern on its back.
meanings.sent2: The sawlike edges of the leaves made them easy to tear.
meanings.sent3: The sawlike spikes on the cactus were actually soft to touch.
meanings.sent4: His sawlike wit could sometimes be sharp but always entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The sawlike claws of the bear left deep marks in the tree trunk.
